ITEM.name: Introduction to XML
ITEM.text: is a quick overview of XML fundamentals

ITEM.name: Using XML
ITEM.text: is a description of the XML infrastructure available

ITEM.name: Using XML Schemas
ITEM.text: gives advice on how to reference XML schemas from XML files

ITEM.name: Using XPaths
ITEM.text: is a quick overview of XPath and the associated infrastructure

ITEM.name: XML Tips and Tricks
ITEM.text: describes tips for making the best use of the XMLParserItf framework

ITEM.name: Reading XML from a Custom Source
ITEM.text: is an example of parsing XML from a user-defined source with DOM or SAX

ITEM.name: Using the XML Parser with DOM
Reading and Writing XML Documents with DOM
ITEM.text: is an example of using the DOM API to parse existing XML files and saving DOM trees as XML files using various encodings

ITEM.name: Creating XML Documents with DOM
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a new XML document from scratch using the DOM API.

ITEM.name: Navigating the DOM Tree with XPath Expressions
ITEM.text: is an example of navigation in a DOM tree using XPath expressions.

ITEM.name: Using XPath Expressions and XML Namespaces Together
ITEM.text: is an example of use of XPath expressions in an XML document which uses namespaces.

ITEM.name: Using the XML Parser with SAX
Parsing XML Documents with SAX
ITEM.text: is an example of using a SAX parser to read XML documents, with or without validation

ITEM.name: Validating XML Documents with SAX
ITEM.text: is an example of using XML schemas with a SAX parser to validate an XML document

ITEM.name: Generating XML Documents Efficiently
ITEM.text: is an example of how to generate XML document with the XML writer API, an API which complements the SAX API.
